div.p: 3455 Table Mesa Blvd. Apt i203 • Boulder, CO 80305
Software engineer seeking full-time position either in Boulder, CO, or working remotely.

ul.li: I work on the Google Earth Enterprise Platform (GEEP), a collection of value added products and services based on the open source Google Earth Enterprise software (OpenGEE).
I helped implement and benchmark a plugin for storing Google Earth data natively in S3, using the AWS C++ SDK.
I added support for triangulated irregular network (TIN) terrain data to the GEEP ATAK plugin using the Java-based ATAK plugin SDK, JNI, and C++.
I've fixed bugs and worked on several small features using C++, Python, GDAL, QGis, and PostGIS.
I review and test pull requests from my coworkers and open source developers.
I assist with our build and packaging pipelines, using several AWS services (S3, EC2, etc.), Jenkins, and Docker
I help with manual and automated testing.
This position is 100% remote.
Worked on the large C++ codebase of the Element software that controls the SolidFire storage system.
Responsible for refactoring, and then maintaining, the drive management sub-system, which keeps track of drives and starts and stops the services associated with them.
Worked on smaller features and enhancements, including improvements to fault detection, API improvements, and hardware monitoring.
Spent time on the White Box Testing Team, and helped add the Recorder sub-system for structured (JSON) logging.
Used valgrind, Coverity, and code coverage tools to improve code quality and reduce bugs.
Occassionally "on call" for support escalations.
Worked on the Interop translation portion of the new CATIA Geometric Modeller (CGM) based product. Used C++, Python and Scheme for test generation.
Used Agile development in the Productivity and Tools group to develop the internal "TestCenter" web application. Used Java, JSP, JUnit, MySQL and Tomcat.
Maintained the "Quality Checker" (QC) component of TestCenter in C++.
Participated in a "team room" with Interop developers to develop the beta release of the CGM Writer component.
Participated in a "team room" with ACIS developers to develop of new CGM componenent.
Initially worked in the "DBA Group", developing a web interface for creating, verifying, and managing Unique Identifier (UID) labels.
Took over development of the internal DBA website.
Created a C++ application for hand-held bar code scanners to communicate with existing inventory management system.
Volunteered for, and eventually moved to, a "Systems" development position, writing Jovial and x86 assembly language for the Automated Remote Tracking Station Software (ARTS).
Assisted with maintenance and deployment of ARTS at customer sites.
This position required a Secret level security clearance.
Maintained 1.5 million lines of C++ code using DCE RPC, Oracle 10g, and Solaris for the server portion of the CarlX library management system.
Used Ruby to automate testing and bug reproduction.
Refactored code to improve readability and efficiency.
Developed call routing applications for Verizon's Next Generation Service Network (NGSN).
Performed QA on applications built by other developers.
Performed troubleshooting and corrected trouble tickets.

div.div: University of Colorado At Colorado Springs

div.p: Received Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with minor in Economics

In my free time I work on a number of open source projects which are available on GitHub and SourceHut. Most are small personal projects, but I've also made many contributions to other projects, including st-json, a popular Common Lisp JSON library, and OpenGEE, the open source version of Google Earth Enterprise.
